info.name: India World Bank
info.description:
Queries related to the project with India World Bank and Mobilpedia.

It is important that you define your own Environment with the following variables:

- __filename__, name of the file to be uploaded into the Object Storage.
- __keystone-token__, X-Auth-Token id, requested to the IdM (X-Subject-Token value). See _Get Auth Token_ query for more details.
- __projectID__, id of the project associated to your FIWARE Lab user accont. You can obtain the value in [Identity, Projects, Project ID](https://cloud.lab.fiware.org/identity/).
- __containerName__, container name used in the Object Storage queries.
- __idm-token__, authentication token obtained in the operation _Request a token to IdM_.
- __applicationID__, application ID used to make the examples of the IdM. You can obtain it in the response of the _Create an application_ operation or in the _List applications_.
- __userID__, user ID used in the examples of the IdM.
- __roleID__, role ID used in the examples. You can obtain the value in the operation _Create a role in one appliation_.
- __entityType__, entity Type used in the current examples.
- __FIWARE-Service__, FIWARE Service associated to the data available in the Orion instance (e.g. mobilepediacity).
- __FIWARE-ServicePath__, FIWARE Service Path used in the current examples (e.g. /).
- __entityID__, entity ID associated to the data stored in the current example. You can obtain the value in _Get Entities_ query.

item.name: Orion Context Broker

request.description:
Gets all the entities associated to and specific entity type, shown in key-value format.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format with detailed information about the entities.

Gets all the entities associated to and specific entity type.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format with detailed information about the entities.

Get the version of the installed Orion instance.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format.

Gets the complete list of subscriptions into the Orion instance.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format.

Update the attributes associated to a specific entity.

It returns a __No Content (204)__.

Delete a subscription.

The request returns a __No Content (204)__ message if the operation was completed.

Creates a new subscription. The subscription is represented by a JSON object as described at the beginning of this section.

This operation returns a __Created (201)__ message is the operation is completed succesfully.

item.name: Get the debug level of the instance

request.description:
This operation return the debug level defined in the current instance.

This operation returns a __OK (200)__ messages with the content of the debug level in json format.

item.name: Set the debug level of the instance

request.description:
Change the debug level of the Orion instance with the value defined in the URL. Possible values are INFO, WARN, DEBUG, ERROR.

This operation returns a __200 (OK)__ message with no content if it is completed succesfully.

item.name: Registering a new entity with commands

request.description:
Registering a new entity with a set of commands.

This operation returns Created (201) message.
This command send a switching on command to a Lamp.

item.description: Set of operations used to test the Orion instance in this project. To get more details about the Orion Context Broker API please go to the corresponding documentation [Orion API](https://orioncontextbroker.docs.apiary.io/#)

item.name: Cygnus

request.description:
Get the version of the installed Cygnus instance.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format.

item.name: Set the debug level of the instance Copy

request.description:
Change the debug level of the Cygnus instance with the value defined in the URL. Possible values are INFO, WARN, DEBUG, ERROR.

This operation returns a __200 (OK)__ message with no content if it is completed succesfully.

item.description: Set of queries used to test the connectivity with the Cygnus component. In order to get more details about the use of Cygnus go to [Cygnus API](http://fiware-cygnus.readthedocs.io/en/1.7.0/cygnus-common/installation_and_administration_guide/management_interface_v1/index.html).

item.name: IdM - Keyrock

request.description:
Request a token using v1/auth/token to the IdM-Keyrock instance.

It returns a __Created (201)__ and details about the expiration time in the body. The Authentication Token is returned in the __X-Subject-Token__ header parameter.

Keep in mind that this token is the one that you need to use to request access to the IdM-Keyrock service (X-Auth-Token hedar parameter).

item.name: Lists users registered in the IdM

request.description:
Lists users registered in the IdM. It is mandatory to put the __X-Auth-Token__ header parameter with the correct value.

It returns a __OK (200)__ if there was no problem and the information about the users registered in the IdM-Keyrock instance.

item.name: Delete an user from the IdM

request.description:
Delete a user from the IdM-Keyrock. It is mandatory to put the __X-Auth-Token__ header parameter with the correct value.

It returns a __No Content (204)__ if there was no problem or __Not Found (404)__ if the user cannot be found.

List the registed applications in the IdM-Keystone. It is mandatory to put the X-Auth-Token header parameter with the correct value.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format.

item.name: List of roles associated to an application

request.description:
Returns the list of roles associated to an applicartion in the IdM-Keystone. It is mandatory to put the X-Auth-Token header parameter with the correct value.

It returns a __OK (200)__ and the response in JSON format. In case that the application requested does not exist, it returns a __NOT FOUND (404)__ and a error message in JSON format.

Creates an application inside the IdM-Keyrock instance. It is mandatory to put the X-Auth-Token header parameter with the correct value.

If the data provided is the same the service will create another application with the same information.

It returns a __Created (201)__ and the response in JSON format with detailed information about the created new application.

item.name: Create a role in one application

request.description:
Creates a role inside an application in the IdM-Keyrock instance. It is mandatory to put the X-Auth-Token header parameter with the correct value.

If the data provided is the same, the service will create another role with the same information. If the application id provided is wrong the service returns __Not Found (404)__ message.

It returns a __Created (201)__ and the response in JSON format with detailed information about the created new role.

item.name: Assign a role to a user

request.description:
Assign a role to a user inside an application. It is mandatory to put the X-Auth-Token header parameter with the correct value.

If the data provided is the same, the service will create another role with the same information.

It returns a __Created (201)__ and the response in JSON format with detailed information about the assignement.

item.description: Queries used to check the functionalities of the IdM-Keyrock. If you want to get more details about this service go to the [IdM-Keyrock API](https://keyrock.docs.apiary.io/#) for more details.

item.name: OpenStack (FIWARE Lab)

request.description:
Authenticates an identity and generates a token. Uses the token authentication method and scopes authorization to a project.

The request body includes the payload that specifies the token authentication method which includes the token in addition to a project.

The response includes the X-Subject-Token parameter, which is the authentication token to be used in the rest of OpenStack requests (X-Auth-Token header parameter).

Shows details for an account and lists containers, sorted by name, in the account.

The response body returns a list of containers. The default response (__text/plain__) returns one container per line. Nevertheless, we can specify the query option __format__ with value JSON to show the result data in json format.

When asking for a list of containers and there are none, the response behavior changes depending on whether the request format is text, JSON, or XML. For a text response, you get a __204__ , because there is no content. However, for a JSON or XML response, you get a __200__ with content indicating an empty array.

Creates a container.

You do not need to check whether a container already exists before issuing a PUT operation because the operation is idempotent: It creates a container or updates an existing container, as appropriate.

request.description:
Creates an object with data content and metadata, or replaces an existing object with data content and metadata.

The PUT operation always creates an object. If you use this operation on an existing object, you replace the existing object and metadata rather than modifying the object. Consequently, this operation returns the __Created (201)__ response code.

If you use this operation to copy a manifest object, the new object is a normal object and not a copy of the manifest. Instead it is a concatenation of all the segment objects. This means that you cannot copy objects larger than 5 GB.

Note that the provider may have limited the characters which are allowed in an object name. Any name limits are exposed under the __name_check__ key in the __/info__ discoverability response. Regardless of __name_check__ limitations, names must be URL quoted UTF-8.

Creates an object with data content and metadata, or replaces an existing object with data content and metadata. In that case the content is a binary file, therefore, in body we can especify a binary content and need to choose a concrete file.

This operation returns the __Created (201)__ response code.

Downloads the object content and gets the object metadata.

This operation returns the object metadata in the response headers and the object content in the response body.

If this is a large object, the response body contains the concatenated content of the segment objects. To get the manifest instead of concatenated segment objects for a static large object, use the __multipart-manifest__ query parameter.

Keep in mind that in order to save the content of the response you have to select the option __Send and Download__.

item.description:
Set of requests in order to work with the FIWARE Lab environment (OpenStack). For more details about the available request go to:

- [OpenStack Identity Service (Keystone) API](https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/).
- [OpenStack Object Storage (Swift] API](https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/object-store/).

item.name: IoT Agent
Send measurements to the IoT Agent

request.description:
Sends measurements to the IoT Agent.

This operation returns a __OK (200)__ message is the operation was completed succesfully.

Get detailed information of registered device in the IoT Agent.

This operation returns a __OK (200)__ message with the information about the requested device in json format.

Get information about the registered service in the IoT Agent.

This operation returns a __OK (200)__ message with the information about the service in json format.

Register a new service in the IoT Agent.

This operation returns __Created (201)__ message.

Register a new sensor in the IoT Agent.

This operation returns __Created (201)__ message.

Register a new device with some commands.

This operation returns Created (201) message.

item.description: Provide some example queries to work with IoT Agent (Ultralight verion)

item.name: Get the historical data stored in the DB.

request.description:
Get the historical data stored in the DB.

The request returns __OK (200)__ message with the content in JSON format.
